dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Noor Ali Zadran b Dawlat Zadran 83 (138b 6x4 3x6) SR: 60.14

dismissalComment.html: another short ball, this one is shoulder high, angling into the batsman, and he goes for the pull and picks out the fielder at deep square leg

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf 58 (75b 3x4 3x6) SR: 77.33

dismissalComment.html: oh my. What a way to lose a wicket. It's a floaty full-toss outside off, and he goes after it and picks out the man at long-on

bowled him! Chigumbura steps out of his crease, and he is nowhere near the pitch to play such an aggressive shot, looking to smash that through extra cover. It's just the perfect length, and it swings back in, beats the inside-edge, and knocks back off stump

bowled him! Stuck on the crease, and Ashraf bowls a spectacular inducker, jags in from outside off and knocks back off stump as Raza tries to bring his bat down to defend. The length defeated him even more than the movement, I think
oh my. What a way to lose a wicket. It's a floaty full-toss outside off, and he goes after it and picks out the man at long-on
gone! Zimbabwe are two down! Back of a length, and this one leaves Chibhabha off the pitch. Goes for the punch away from the body, and only succeeds in nicking to the keeper
another short ball, this one is shoulder high, angling into the batsman, and he goes for the pull and picks out the fielder at deep square leg

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor lbw b Amir Hamza 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery, and this one is plumb. Moor is stuck in the crease, and this one slides in with the arm again. This time, the line was straighter, and it struck him in line with middle stump and would probably have gone on to hit middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! Zimbabwe are two down! Back of a length, and this one leaves Chibhabha off the pitch. Goes for the punch away from the body, and only succeeds in nicking to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Shahzad b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami c Mohammad Shahzad b Mohammad Nabi 14 (28b 2x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: slow flight outside off, big shout for caught behind after Mutumbami sweeps over the ball. Was there a bottom edge on it? The umpire thought long and hard, and finally raised his finger. There certainly seemed to be a sound as it passed his bat

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Mirwais Ashraf 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Chigumbura steps out of his crease, and he is nowhere near the pitch to play such an aggressive shot, looking to smash that through extra cover. It's just the perfect length, and it swings back in, beats the inside-edge, and knocks back off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza b Mirwais Ashraf 1 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Stuck on the crease, and Ashraf bowls a spectacular inducker, jags in from outside off and knocks back off stump as Raza tries to bring his bat down to defend. The length defeated him even more than the movement, I think

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller run out (Amir Hamza/Mohammad Shahzad) 8 (13b 2x4 0x6) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: back of a length close to off stump, and that's a run out. What a way to lose a wicket in this situation. Punched towards point, and he sets off for a single. He's halfway down the pitch before Masakadza sends him back, rightly so. Hamza moves left from cover point, fields the ball on his natural side, throws to the keeper, who picks up the throw on the half-volley and has the bails off in a flash

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Rashid Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe c Mohammad Nabi b Rashid Khan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone, and that's a super catch by Nabi. Flighted ball outside off, turns away, and he can only outside edge as he drives away from his body. Goes quickly to the left of slip, and Nabi does brilliantly to dive and grab it in both hands

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf 58 (75b 3x4 3x6) SR: 77.33

dismissalComment.html: oh my. What a way to lose a wicket. It's a floaty full-toss outside off, and he goes after it and picks out the man at long-on

dismissalText.commentary: Neville Madziva lbw b Amir Hamza 0 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that's plumb, beautifully bowled. Saw one a little shorter and shuffled across to work it into the leg side. Slid on, hurried through, and smacked his front pad right in front of the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Noor Ali Zadran b Dawlat Zadran 83 (138b 6x4 3x6) SR: 60.14

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Chigumbura b Chisoro 31 (22b 4x4 1x6) SR: 140.9

dismissalComment.html: flighted ball on off stump, and Shahzad has thrown his wicket away. Looks like he wanted to hit it over mid-off and got too close to the pitch of the ball. Didn't get the elevation he wanted and Chigumbura dives forward to take a good low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran not out 7 (21b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: got him! He's been angling them across right through these two overs, and this pitched in the perfect spot. Not too wide outside off, not full enough to drive, and Hashmatullah went at it with an angled bat and edged to Masakadza at wide slip

got him, another catch for that wide slip fielder. This time it's the right-handed batsman, Ashraf. Back of a length outside off, straightens just a touch. Ashraf punches at it, away from his body, and the thick edge falls right into Masakadza's lap

full outside off, not full enough to drive, and Jongwe has another wicket! Seams away with some extra bounce, and Shenwari walks into a drive and edges to the keeper. Once again, his front-foot movement is a touch too late

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: short, wide, and he's cut that straight to cover point. It was there to be hit, he hit it well, but didn't keep it down, and Waller barely had to move to complete the catch

back of a length down the leg side, and it's all over. Jongwe finishes with a five-for as Hamza, looking to glance it off his hips, gets a little tickle through to Mutumbami, who takes another excellent catch, diving to his left this time

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! off-stump yorker, and it's straightened past his outside edge and taken out off stump. That's a sensational delivery
gone, he's on a hat-trick! Wide outswinger, Nabi went for the drive away from his body, and Mutumbami moves smartly to his right to take a good catch at shoulder height, with arms at full stretch

and another! This is beautifully bowled, another one straightens outside off. Shafiqullah pokes with hard hands, away from his body, and Mutumbami dives at full stretch to his right to take a super low catch in one glove

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! off-stump yorker, and it's straightened past his outside edge and taken out off stump. That's a sensational delivery

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Mutumbami b Madziva 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone, he's on a hat-trick! Wide outswinger, Nabi went for the drive away from his body, and Mutumbami moves smartly to his right to take a good catch at shoulder height, with arms at full stretch

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c Madziva b Chisoro 6 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: down the leg side, and fine leg was in the circle. That would count as a bad ball on most occasions, but Stanikzai sweeps uppishly and straight to the fielder. A few feet either side of him and that would have been four

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Amir Hamza c Mutumbami b Jongwe 1 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 8.33

commentTextItems.html: back of a length down the leg side, and it's all over. Jongwe finishes with a five-for as Hamza, looking to glance it off his hips, gets a little tickle through to Mutumbami, who takes another excellent catch, diving to his left this time

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.45pm That's it from all of us here. A very enjoyable game of cricket to bring to you all, and we hope you enjoyed our coverage. I'll leave you with a few comments from our readers. Until next time, good night!
Praneeth: "Hope this win act as the catalyst for Zimbabwe to take the U-turn after a terrible 2015."
Abdul Samad War: "It is not Afghan tigers' mistake it is magic cat power."

Josh: "1st and 3rd games have been rather odd. The team batting first seems to have lost it by the innings break and then then the team batting 2nd makes them look superb. Guess you can never judge a pitch until both sides bat."

8.35pm Time for some quotes from the presentation. First up, Hamilton Masakadza, the man of the match: "Got in at a very difficult time, credit to Cremer for the support he gave me, and the bowlers did very well as well. Cremer has always been a good batsman. I've been on the wrong end of a 170 from him in a first-class game. We managed to bat as long as we wanted to and managed to get a few hits away towards the end. It's good that we've managed to keep the series alive, hope we can keep this momentum."

Asghar Stanikzai: "Our bowlers started very well. Good partnership between Masakadza and Cremer, but a total of 175 was [chaseable]. The wicket is not too difficult but our batsmen played poor shots and their bowlers bowled very well. We have more opportunity in the next game, inshallah we play good cricket."

Elton Chigumbura: "It's a good start to the year. All credit goes to Hamilton, Graeme Cremer, and the two bowlers who gave us a good start. Getting those two wickets in the first over set the tone for us. It's good to see that we've got strike bowlers. I hope Jongwe carries on with the form he showed today. It's important for us in the next game to come out firing again. The way we started with the bat was disappointing. It was important that we bounced back. The way Cremer supported Hamilton was fantastic. To end up on 175 gave us a chance to come and defend the score. It's been a long time since we won a game. It's a good start to the year and I hope we carry on."

10.20pm What a turnaround, and what a win for Zimbabwe. They were 49 for 7 when Masakadza and Cremer came together, and their partnership dragged them to 175. It still looked an inadequate total, but Zimbabwe defended it with some exceptional bowling, even if Afghanistan's technique and shot selection left a lot to be desired. The series has heated up brilliantly now: Afghanistan lead 2-1, and two more matches remain.

commentTextItems.html: length ball sliding into the pad, tucked away through square leg

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: wow. Drifts in towards off stump and spins like it had the combined revs of Shane Warne and Stuart MacGill's biggest legbreaks, beats the outside edge by a mile
length ball on middle stump, goes on the back foot and punches to long-off
now he flights it and Dawlat goes after it, opening his shoulders as he swings through the line, and hits it straight down the ground, one bounce for four
this one slides straight on as he presses forward to defend, misses the bat by a long way and strikes the front pad low down. In front of middle stump. I have no idea how that was not given out.

commentPreTextItems.html: Praneeth : "Oh my goodness! The last time I checked the score, Zimbabwe were at 55/7. Didn't check back thinking the game is over for them. But now, it's all over for Afghans at 50/9. Can someone tell me what the hell happened in between?" -- Take a long, close look at the scorecard, my friend. And also Vishal Dikshit's innings report, which will soon be updated to include the rest of the match.

commentTextItems.html: flattish length ball turning from leg to off, defended with soft hands, bottom hand nowhere near the handle
shortish, angling into off stump. Hamza rides the bounce well and defends with soft hands towards point

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: full, angling into off stump, defended solidly into the covers
full on middle and off, and Dawlat is squared up looking to work it into the leg side. Ball runs away to third man off the back of his bat
length ball wide of off, Dawlat leaves again, and it carries at over head height to the keeper
length ball outside off, no footwork from Dawlat and he plays and misses
fullish on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
full outside off, driven to mid-off, and Namibia's record is safe

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentPreTextItems.html: The shortest all-out innings in ODIs was Namibia's 14 overs against Australia during the 2003 World Cup. Two more balls for Afghanistan to avoid setting a new record.

commentTextItems.html: bouncer, he didn't know too much about it. Ducked into it, and it lobbed up behind the wicket off his shoulder
edged, falls short of slip. Length ball outside off, no footwork as he pokes at it, and the edge dies just short of Masakadza
full outside off, stretches out and defends towards backward point
back of a length wide of off, left alone
length ball on middle stump, and Dawlat brings his bat down at the very last moment to defend to mid-on
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery, and this one is plumb. Moor is stuck in the crease, and this one slides in with the arm again. This time, the line was straighter, and it struck him in line with middle stump and would probably have gone on to hit middle and leg
that's plumb, beautifully bowled. Saw one a little shorter and shuffled across to work it into the leg side. Slid on, hurried through, and smacked his front pad right in front of the stumps
gone! Zimbabwe are two down! Back of a length, and this one leaves Chibhabha off the pitch. Goes for the punch away from the body, and only succeeds in nicking to the keeper
another short ball, this one is shoulder high, angling into the batsman, and he goes for the pull and picks out the fielder at deep square leg

slow flight outside off, big shout for caught behind after Mutumbami sweeps over the ball. Was there a bottom edge on it? The umpire thought long and hard, and finally raised his finger. There certainly seemed to be a sound as it passed his bat

bowled him! Chigumbura steps out of his crease, and he is nowhere near the pitch to play such an aggressive shot, looking to smash that through extra cover. It's just the perfect length, and it swings back in, beats the inside-edge, and knocks back off stump

bowled him! Stuck on the crease, and Ashraf bowls a spectacular inducker, jags in from outside off and knocks back off stump as Raza tries to bring his bat down to defend. The length defeated him even more than the movement, I think
oh my. What a way to lose a wicket. It's a floaty full-toss outside off, and he goes after it and picks out the man at long-on

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: gone, and that's a super catch by Nabi. Flighted ball outside off, turns away, and he can only outside edge as he drives away from his body. Goes quickly to the left of slip, and Nabi does brilliantly to dive and grab it in both hands

headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor lbw b Amir Hamza 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: lovely delivery, and this one is plumb. Moor is stuck in the crease, and this one slides in with the arm again. This time, the line was straighter, and it struck him in line with middle stump and would probably have gone on to hit middle and leg

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! Zimbabwe are two down! Back of a length, and this one leaves Chibhabha off the pitch. Goes for the punch away from the body, and only succeeds in nicking to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Shahzad b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami c Mohammad Shahzad b Mohammad Nabi 14 (28b 2x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: slow flight outside off, big shout for caught behind after Mutumbami sweeps over the ball. Was there a bottom edge on it? The umpire thought long and hard, and finally raised his finger. There certainly seemed to be a sound as it passed his bat

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Mirwais Ashraf 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Chigumbura steps out of his crease, and he is nowhere near the pitch to play such an aggressive shot, looking to smash that through extra cover. It's just the perfect length, and it swings back in, beats the inside-edge, and knocks back off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza b Mirwais Ashraf 1 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 14.28

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Stuck on the crease, and Ashraf bowls a spectacular inducker, jags in from outside off and knocks back off stump as Raza tries to bring his bat down to defend. The length defeated him even more than the movement, I think

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller run out (Amir Hamza/Mohammad Shahzad) 8 (13b 2x4 0x6) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: back of a length close to off stump, and that's a run out. What a way to lose a wicket in this situation. Punched towards point, and he sets off for a single. He's halfway down the pitch before Masakadza sends him back, rightly so. Hamza moves left from cover point, fields the ball on his natural side, throws to the keeper, who picks up the throw on the half-volley and has the bails off in a flash

headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Rashid Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe c Mohammad Nabi b Rashid Khan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone, and that's a super catch by Nabi. Flighted ball outside off, turns away, and he can only outside edge as he drives away from his body. Goes quickly to the left of slip, and Nabi does brilliantly to dive and grab it in both hands

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer c Mohammad Nabi b Mirwais Ashraf 58 (75b 3x4 3x6) SR: 77.33

dismissalComment.html: oh my. What a way to lose a wicket. It's a floaty full-toss outside off, and he goes after it and picks out the man at long-on

dismissalComment.html: that's plumb, beautifully bowled. Saw one a little shorter and shuffled across to work it into the leg side. Slid on, hurried through, and smacked his front pad right in front of the stumps

dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza c Noor Ali Zadran b Dawlat Zadran 83 (138b 6x4 3x6) SR: 60.14

dismissalComment.html: another short ball, this one is shoulder high, angling into the batsman, and he goes for the pull and picks out the fielder at deep square leg

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran b Madziva 0 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! off-stump yorker, and it's straightened past his outside edge and taken out off stump. That's a sensational delivery

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Chigumbura b Chisoro 31 (22b 4x4 1x6) SR: 140.9

dismissalComment.html: flighted ball on off stump, and Shahzad has thrown his wicket away. Looks like he wanted to hit it over mid-off and got too close to the pitch of the ball. Didn't get the elevation he wanted and Chigumbura dives forward to take a good low catch

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Mutumbami b Madziva 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone, he's on a hat-trick! Wide outswinger, Nabi went for the drive away from his body, and Mutumbami moves smartly to his right to take a good catch at shoulder height, with arms at full stretch

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c Madziva b Chisoro 6 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: down the leg side, and fine leg was in the circle. That would count as a bad ball on most occasions, but Stanikzai sweeps uppishly and straight to the fielder. A few feet either side of him and that would have been four

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c Masakadza b Jongwe 3 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 21.42

dismissalComment.html: got him! He's been angling them across right through these two overs, and this pitched in the perfect spot. Not too wide outside off, not full enough to drive, and Hashmatullah went at it with an angled bat and edged to Masakadza at wide slip

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mirwais Ashraf c Masakadza b Jongwe 1 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: got him, another catch for that wide slip fielder. This time it's the right-handed batsman, Ashraf. Back of a length outside off, straightens just a touch. Ashraf punches at it, away from his body, and the thick edge falls right into Masakadza's lap

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Mutumbami b Jongwe 2 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: full outside off, not full enough to drive, and Jongwe has another wicket! Seams away with some extra bounce, and Shenwari walks into a drive and edges to the keeper. Once again, his front-foot movement is a touch too late

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiqullah c Mutumbami b Madziva 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and another! This is beautifully bowled, another one straightens outside off. Shafiqullah pokes with hard hands, away from his body, and Mutumbami dives at full stretch to his right to take a super low catch in one glove

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan c Waller b Jongwe 3 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: short, wide, and he's cut that straight to cover point. It was there to be hit, he hit it well, but didn't keep it down, and Waller barely had to move to complete the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran not out 7 (21b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Amir Hamza c Mutumbami b Jongwe 1 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 8.33

dismissalComment.html: back of a length down the leg side, and it's all over. Jongwe finishes with a five-for as Hamza, looking to glance it off his hips, gets a little tickle through to Mutumbami, who takes another excellent catch, diving to his left this time

notes: Drinks: Zimbabwe - 48/5 in 16.0 overs (H Masakadza 24, MN Waller 8)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 19.1 overs (115 balls), Extras 0
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 31.3 overs (189 balls), Extras 0
8th Wicket: 50 runs in 75 balls (H Masakadza 19, AG Cremer 32, Ex 0)
H Masakadza: 50 off 98 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 108/7 in 34.0 overs (H Masakadza 50, AG Cremer 34)
AG Cremer: 50 off 63 balls (2 x 4, 3 x 6)
8th Wicket: 100 runs in 130 balls (H Masakadza 41, AG Cremer 57, Ex 2)
Zimbabwe: 150 runs in 40.5 overs (245 balls), Extras 2
Innings Break: Zimbabwe - 175/10 in 48.3 overs (TS Chisoro 6)
Afghanistan: 50 runs in 11.1 overs (67 balls), Extras 4
Drinks: Afghanistan - 52/9 in 15.0 overs (Dawlat Zadran 2, Amir Hamza 0)

milestones.description: Dawlat Zadran has broken the record for most ducks (4) in ODIs for AFG, going past Nawroz Mangal's 4

stories.title: Zimbabwe keep series alive with comeback win
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Sharjah
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe keep series alive with comeback win
stories.summary: The new year brought in new fortunes for Zimbabwe's bowlers, but not their batsman, as they snatched a 117-run win from Afghanistan in the third ODI in Sharjah to keep the five-match series alive

image.caption: Hamilton Masakadza steers the ball through the off side during his fifty
image.longCaption: Hamilton Masakadza steers the ball through the off side during his fifty, Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Sharjah, January 2, 2016

stories.title: Zimbabwe under pressure to stay afloat
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Sharjah
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe under pressure to stay afloat
stories.summary: After having conceded a 2-0 lead to Afghanistan, Zimbabwe are under fire to bounce back and keep the series alive

recentReportStory.subTitle: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Sharjah
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Zimbabwe keep series alive with comeback win
recentReportStory.summary: The new year brought in new fortunes for Zimbabwe's bowlers, but not their batsman, as they snatched a 117-run win from Afghanistan in the third ODI in Sharjah to keep the five-match series alive

image.caption: Hamilton Masakadza steers the ball through the off side during his fifty
image.longCaption: Hamilton Masakadza steers the ball through the off side during his fifty, Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Sharjah, January 2, 2016

recentReportStory.credit: Vishal Dikshit is a sub-editor at ESPNcricinfo

recentPreviewStory.title: Zimbabwe under pressure to stay afloat
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Sharjah
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Zimbabwe under pressure to stay afloat
recentPreviewStory.summary: After having conceded a 2-0 lead to Afghanistan, Zimbabwe are under fire to bounce back and keep the series alive

image.caption: Noor Ali Zadran played some attractive shots in his 44
image.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran played some attractive shots in his 44, Afghanistan v Pakistan, Asia Cup 2014, Fatullah, February 27, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Deivarayan Muthu is a sub-editor at ESPNcricinfo

9.title: 2nd ODI
9.statusText: Afghanistan won by 4 wickets (with 14 balls remaining)
